files.patch:
@@ -136,0 +136,2 @@
+  bool                       _was_scalar_replaced;     // Whether this ObjectValue describes an object scalar replaced or just
+                                                       // an object (possibly null) participating in an allocation merge.
@@ -141,1 +143,1 @@
-  ObjectValue(int id, ScopeValue* klass)
+  ObjectValue(int id, ScopeValue* klass = nullptr, bool was_scalar_replaced = true)
@@ -147,0 +149,1 @@
+     , _was_scalar_replaced(was_scalar_replaced)
@@ -148,1 +151,1 @@
-    assert(klass->is_constant_oop(), "should be constant java mirror oop");
+    assert(klass == nullptr || klass->is_constant_oop(), "should be constant java mirror oop");
@@ -151,8 +154,0 @@
-  ObjectValue(int id)
-     : _id(id)
-     , _klass(nullptr)
-     , _field_values()
-     , _value()
-     , _visited(false)
-     , _is_root(true) {}
-
@@ -168,0 +163,1 @@
+  bool was_scalar_replaced() const { return _was_scalar_replaced; }
@@ -173,0 +169,1 @@
+  void                        set_was_scalar_replaced(bool scd) { _was_scalar_replaced = scd; }
@@ -211,1 +208,1 @@
-     : ObjectValue(id)
+     : ObjectValue(id, nullptr, false)
@@ -218,1 +215,1 @@
-     : ObjectValue(id)
+     : ObjectValue(id, nullptr, false)

@@ -151,3 +151,3 @@
-      // If select() returns nullptr, then the object doesn't need to be
-      // rematerialized.
-      if (sv == nullptr) {
+      // 'select(...)' may return an ObjectValue that actually represents a
+      // non-scalar replaced object participating in a merge.
+      if (!sv->was_scalar_replaced()) {

@@ -636,0 +636,8 @@
+    case T_OBJECT:
+    case T_ARRAY:
+    case T_ADDRESS:
+    case T_METADATA:
+      return new CmpPNode(in1, in2);
+    case T_NARROWOOP:
+    case T_NARROWKLASS:
+      return new CmpNNode(in1, in2);

@@ -298,2 +298,1 @@
-    @IR(counts = { IRNode.ALLOC, "2" })
-    // Merge won't be reduced because the inputs to the Phi have different Klasses
+    @IR(failOn = { IRNode.ALLOC })
@@ -407,2 +406,1 @@
-    @IR(counts = { IRNode.ALLOC, "1" })
-    // The merge won't be simplified because the merge with NULL
+    @IR(failOn = { IRNode.ALLOC })
@@ -514,1 +512,0 @@
-    // Merge won't be reduced because, among other things, one of the inputs is null.
@@ -534,2 +531,1 @@
-    @IR(counts = { IRNode.ALLOC, "1" })
-    // The allocation won't be removed because the merge doesn't have exact type
+    @IR(failOn = { IRNode.ALLOC })
@@ -566,3 +562,1 @@
-    @IR(counts = { IRNode.ALLOC, "2" })
-    // The initial allocation assigned to 's' will always be dead.
-    // The other two allocations assigned to 's' won't be removed because they have different type.
+    @IR(failOn = { IRNode.ALLOC })
@@ -594,1 +588,1 @@
-    @IR(counts = { IRNode.ALLOC, "2" })
+    @IR(failOn = { IRNode.ALLOC })
@@ -624,3 +618,1 @@
-    @IR(counts = { IRNode.ALLOC, "2" })
-    // The unused allocation will be removed.
-    // The other two allocations assigned to 's' won't be removed because they have different type.
+    @IR(failOn = { IRNode.ALLOC })
@@ -1235,1 +1227,1 @@
-    @IR(counts = { IRNode.ALLOC, "0" })
+    @IR(failOn = { IRNode.ALLOC })
@@ -1256,1 +1248,1 @@
-    @IR(counts = { IRNode.ALLOC, "0" })
+    @IR(failOn = { IRNode.ALLOC })
